articles.headline: G.M. Backs Rule to Curb Carbon-Monoxide Risk in Keyless Cars
articles.snippet: Departing from the industry’s longtime opposition, the automaker endorsed a mandate for vehicles to have alerts and precautions to address the hazard.
articles.abstract: Departing from the industry’s longtime opposition, the automaker endorsed a mandate for vehicles to have alerts and precautions to address the hazard.
articles.lead_paragraph: Forgetting to shut off a keyless vehicle has been a safety hazard for years, causing a growing number of carbon-monoxide deaths. But a proposed regulation to require warning signals and other precautions has languished in the face of opposition from the auto industry.

articles.headline: Trump vs. Cohen: The Breakup of a New York Relationship
articles.snippet: The bond, as Michael D. Cohen and associates described it, was a mix of father and son, lawyer and client, and the blind loyalty of henchman to crime boss.
articles.abstract: The bond, as Michael D. Cohen and associates described it, was a mix of father and son, lawyer and client, and the blind loyalty of henchman to crime boss.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — He has spent months inside his Park Avenue apartment glued to cable news, his legal bills growing and federal prosecutors amassing evidence against him they would use as leverage.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Even as President, Trump Focused on Hush Money, Cohen Says
articles.snippet: The president’s former lawyer, speaking to Congress, also implicated Donald Jr. and the Trump Organization’s chief financial officer in an arrangement to pay off Stormy Daniels.
articles.abstract: The president’s former lawyer, speaking to Congress, also implicated Donald Jr. and the Trump Organization’s chief financial officer in an arrangement to pay off Stormy Daniels.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s former lawyer told Congress on Wednesday that Mr. Trump remained deeply involved in the arrangement to pay hush money to a pornographic film actress, even while in the White House, telling him just a year ago to lie to a journalist about the president’s involvement.

articles.headline: Michael Cohen Accuses Trump of Expansive Pattern of Lies and Criminality
articles.snippet: Mr. Cohen, the president’s former lawyer, said he had lied to Congress to protect President Trump. “I am not protecting Mr. Trump anymore,” Mr. Cohen said.
articles.abstract: Mr. Cohen, the president’s former lawyer, said he had lied to Congress to protect President Trump. “I am not protecting Mr. Trump anymore,” Mr. Cohen said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s longtime lawyer and fixer accused him on Wednesday of an expansive pattern of lies and criminality, offering a damning portrayal of life inside the president’s orbit where he said advisers sacrificed integrity for proximity to power.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Arbitrator Scolds Fox and Orders It to Pay $178 Million to ‘Bones’ Team
articles.snippet: A surprise ruling accuses several Fox executives of a “pattern of deceit” in how they divvied up the profits for a crime show that lasted 12 seasons.
articles.abstract: A surprise ruling accuses several Fox executives of a “pattern of deceit” in how they divvied up the profits for a crime show that lasted 12 seasons.
articles.lead_paragraph: A private arbitrator ruled this month that Fox must pay the extraordinary sum of $178.7 million to former producers and stars of the procedural crime television series “Bones” in a dispute over profit participation.
articles.byline: By John Koblin and Edmund Lee

articles.headline: A New Editor, and a New Take on Brexit, for a Brawny London Tabloid
articles.snippet: No more “Enemies of the People” headlines under Geordie Greig, the Eton- and Oxford-educated editor of the pugnacious Daily Mail.
articles.abstract: No more “Enemies of the People” headlines under Geordie Greig, the Eton- and Oxford-educated editor of the pugnacious Daily Mail.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Just past the entrance to the airy headquarters of The Daily Mail, Britain’s pugnacious and politically powerful publication, stands a sculpture of three small spheres with wings. The title is hidden away on a small plaque: “Bullets of Information.”

articles.headline: U.S. Economy Cooled as G.D.P. Grew at 2.6% Rate in Fourth Quarter
articles.snippet: The pace slowed from midyear after losing the momentum generated by tax cuts.
articles.abstract: The pace slowed from midyear after losing the momentum generated by tax cuts.
articles.lead_paragraph: The American economy slowed at the end of 2018 — and there could be a further slowdown to come.

articles.headline: Facebook and Telegram Are Hoping to Succeed Where Bitcoin Failed
articles.snippet: Even as cryptocurrency prices have plunged, several big tech companies are working on their own digital tokens for use in text messaging systems.
articles.abstract: Even as cryptocurrency prices have plunged, several big tech companies are working on their own digital tokens for use in text messaging systems.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Some of the world’s biggest internet messaging companies are hoping to succeed where cryptocurrency start-ups have failed by introducing mainstream consumers to the alternative world of digital coins.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Mike Isaac
